challengeName: Sunshot - Building DataCloud UI Prototype Challenge
detailedRequirements:
Welcome to SunShot - Building DataCloud Application UI Prototype Challenge

The main task of this project is to create the SunShot - Building DataCloud Application UI Prototype based on the provided PSD Storyboard design. For this challenge you just need focus on Desktop layout with responsive solution.

Good luck and we’re looking forward to your submissions!
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
Downloadable Files:
Storyboard.zip - Storyboard Design

Important!
- For this UI Prototype submission we need your submission support responsive solution with focus on Desktop only!
- Provided storyboard for Desktop version using widescreen display (1280px width).  
- All pages inside this UI Prototype submissions will use fluid layout
- As possible we need all pages on this prototype linked each other. Let us know if you need clarification about the flow.
- Your prototype need submit correct informations. Pay attention to all small details, let us know if need clarifications.
- Match similar fonts in your submission. Use "Helvetica Neue” font in your UI Prototype Submission
- For this challenge you must use AngularJS and Bootstrap.
- All datas as possible need loaded by JSON

UI Prototype Page Requirements

A. First-Time User Flow
1) First Time User Login Page
screenshot: bdc_02 First Time Login.png
- This is Login Page look and feel
- Left side, there’s application logo
- Put fixed width for white background area
- And background image in the right side need use fluid background image
- Welcome and Login form must always placed in the left side
- This is login page for the first time user, they will enter their email and the access code
- Show text input for Email and Access code
- To simulate the prototype page flow click Login button take to Welcome Page below

2) Welcome Page
screenshot: bdc_03 Welcome Page.png
- When a user logs in for the first time - this page is shown!
- All page sections need use fluid width
- Application logo and title placed in the left side, and use white background.
- Username placed in the right side
- Welcome page design will provide information about the purpose of the site with “Why, What and How” in 3 columns layout.
- Match typography for those 3 columns.
- Show background image behind the main content area
- “Get Started” button will take the user to “Security and Password” page.

3) Security and Password
screenshot: bdc_04 Security and Password.png
- This page allows the user to modify their profile security and password
- User button in the header bar become active when access this page
- Main content area divided by 2 section
- Left side will be disabled by default. User cannot click link or anything from this area
- Right side area need use fluid width.
- Password section, Enter Password field need capture Password Check Strength
- Password format legend displayed in the bottom of input
- Once typed password match the rule, legend need to be active indicated by grey dark square
- Password Checker Strength rule are:
-- At least 7 chars
-- Contains Uppercase (A - Z)
-- Contains lowercase (a - z)
-- Contains Numbers (0 -9)
-- Contains Special Characters (#$%@!*&)
- Password Strength need show different color based on typed value
- See (screenshot: bdc_13 Notes.png) For Password Checker rules
- Confirm password need same like Password field
- Authentication, both will be text inputs
- Security Questions, there will be 3 dropdown
- Show dummy options for those 3 dropdowns
- Click Save button take user to Profile Edit Page.

4) Profile Edit
screenshot: bdc_05 Profile Edit.png
- This is Profile Edit screen
- User can access this page when click Username on header bar
- In the header bar, user see another menu navigation like Search, Setting and Help
- User button in the header bar become active when access this page
- Left side area become enable in this screen
- Edit link take user to Profile Edit page
- Report link need show up the modal window (screenshot: bdc_9.2 Bug report.png)
- User need able to select radio button options
- Notes will be textarea
- Cancel and Submit button need hide the modal
- Main content area divided by 2 columsn
- Left side contains information about the user, their contact details, account information, and My Sites Under management link.
- Click My Sites Under management link need take to another screen
- Right side is place for My Preferences information  
- Match all fields and form styling like checkboxes and text input

5) My Sites Under Management
screenshot: bdc_06 View list of Sites .png
- This page is shown when the user clicks on “My Sites Under management link” from the profile edit page
- There’s breadcrumb on top of page
- Click Profile button take user to Profile screen
- Table layout need fluid layout
- Show active sort order for Phone column, indicated by blue colored title and arrow
- In the right side of table header, there’s filter button. Put dead link for now
- Match table information content
- Site ID is clickable
- Brand(s) column is clickable and use dotted underline
- Hours column is clickable
- Notifications column show 4 notification icons. Please put different text color based on the icons
- Page pagination placed in the left side of table
- Put dead links for all buttons for now

B. Regular User Flow
1) Regular User Login Page
screenshot: bdc_01 Regular User Login Page.png
- Match login text above the form
- Put a checkbox to Remember me option
- Forgot Password placed in the right side, put dead links for now
- Show us validation error screen with red border.
- Login button take user to Dashboard - All Sites page

2) Dashboard - All Sites
screenshot: bdc_07.1.1 All sites.png
- This is dashboard look and feel
- User see “All Sites” page by default
- User button not show active state
- Enterprise is menu link and take user to Enterprise page
- In the left sidebar, there’s main menu navigation for Sites, Notification and Reports
- Show active and inactive menu
- There’s + button in the right side of Sites menu
- User can expand/collapse sub menu by click the “+” button (screenshot: bdc_07.2 Overview tab.png)
- Show input search below the Sites menu
- Active state indicated by bold text and blue highlighted background row.
- User can scrolling sub menu options
- Scrollbar can use browser based style
- Click the “-” button again need collapse the section
- In the main content area, you need build tabs function for “Table View” and “Map View”
- Notice there’s All Sites title in the left side
- And “Table View” and “Map View” in centered of page
- Show “Table View” by default
- Table View Tab, basically table content will be same like in Profile Edit page
- Map View Tab, map need build with Google Map  (screenshot: bdc_07.1.2 All sites - Map View.png)
- There’s some different marker in map
- Show map buttons like zoom in/out, street view icon etc
- There’s marker with numbers too
- Below map, there’s scrolling area for Site information
- When user expand Sites menu by click the “+” button
- User can selected another Site
- And then need open Site Detail screen in the right side area

2) Site Details Page
screenshot: bdc_07.2 Overview tab.png
- This is Site Detail screen look and feel
- Selected Site marked with blue background in the sidemenu list

Overview Tab
- Overview tab show by default
- User can navigate to other Site by click “<” and “>” button that placed below the User button
- OR by navigate to another row from Site menu
- OR user can change to another site when click another marker in map
- Show overview information below the title
- Map area show black marker as Site Details placement
- Other site indicated by smaller and blue colored marker

Notification Tab
screenshot: bdc_07.3 Notifications tab.png
- Notification Detail show table layout format
- All row collapsed by default
- Click each row need ability to expand the row and show up another additional information
- When additional information show up, need displays button, and checkboxes
- All buttons can be dead link
- There’s icon in the right side of each row
- Click the icon need show the modal window (screenshot: bdc_07.4 Details pop-up.png)
- In the modal window, user can access another row by click “<” and “>” button
- Click “x button need hide the modal
- Click Filter button need show up Filter modal (screenshot: bdc_07.5-Filter-pop-up.png)
- Match each column forms
- Need set fixed height for each column
- And need ability to scroll the content for each columns
- Click Reset button need clear all filter selection

Data Tab
screenshot: bdc_07.6 Data tab.png
- This is Data tab
- Show list of All “Sites” status with different color of Progress Bar
- Show animation progress bar on page load

3) Notifications
screenshot: bdc_08.1 Notifications.png
- This is Notifications page look
- Notification page show table layout format
- There’s Notification Preferences in the right side of title. This link take user to another screen
- All rows need collapsed by default
- Click Search button need show overlay background and search input (screenshot: bdc_08.2 Search.png). Implement to all pages
- User can select option between Global and in this section link
- Click “x” button need hide the search
- Match table information for Notification layout
- Click each row need ability to expand the row and show up another additional information
- Put all buttons to be dead link for now

4) Notification Preferences
screenshot: bdc_08.3 Notifications Preferenses.png
- Back button take user to Notification page
- User will have the option to set their preferences by checked on/off the Active checkboxes
- Put dummy value for each dropdown
 
5) Reports Page
screenshot: bdc_9.1 Report Graph.png
- In the right side of title there’s Closed Notification Report and Export data.
- Put dead links for now
- Show chart animation on page load
- Chart need able to drill down (See this example: http://bl.ocks.org/marcbc/raw/3281521/ )

6) Enterprise Page
screenshot: bdc_9.3 Enterprise.png
- Show active menu for Enterprise
- In the main content area, show blocks of Enterprise
- Match data for each blocks
- Site link take to Site page
- Notification  link take to Notification page
- In the bottom right of each block there’s some icons need displayed
- Brand title are clickable and take user to Customer Page

7) Customer Page
screenshot: bdc_10.1 Enterprise, Brand, Site and User List.png
- This is Brand Homepage look and feel
- Home need displayed as active menu
- Show different grey colored theme for header bar and the app icon
- Show different menu for header bar (Help Desk and Device Manager)
- Help Desk menu take to Help Desk page
- Device Manager menu take to Help Desk page
- We need show different left sidebar menu for Brand Page
- In the main content area, show search input on top of screen
- User need able to select radio options
- List Activity need show up with 4 columns layout
- Manage all links placed in the bottom of each column
- Show big “+” button for each column
- Help Desk & Device Manage section need show same format
- Match content for each table

8) Customer Enterprises
screenshot: bdc_10.2.1 List of Enterprises.png
- This page show list of Customer Enterprise
- Search input and button placed on top of screen
- Add New button take user to Add New Enterprises
- Table header need show active sort
- Filter button placed in the right side
- Show blue colored links
- Some links use dotted underline style
- Click on each row need show the details (screenshot: bdc_10.2.2 Details.png)
- Show some list of Brands and Sites links.
- View as Filtered buttons can be dead link

9) Add New Enterprises
screenshot: bdc_10.2.3  Add or Edit.png
- Back button take user to Enterprises page
- Show text inputs for Name, Address, Phone and website
- For Contact(s), Brand(s) and Site(s), need ability to add new row below
- Create button can be dead link

10) List of Brands
screenshot: bdc_10.3 List of Brands.png
- This page show list of Brands
- Search input and button placed on top of screen
- Add New button can be dead link
- Table header need show active sort
- Filter button placed in the right side
- Show blue colored links
- Some links use dotted underline style
- Pagination placed in the bottom
- Match content like storyboard

11) List of Sites
screenshot: bdc_10.4 List of Sites.png
- This page show list of Sites
- Search input and button placed on top of screen
- Add New button can be dead link
- Table header need show active sort
- Filter button placed in the right side
- Show blue colored links
- Some links use dotted underline style
- Pagination placed in the bottom
- Match content like storyboard

12) List of Users
screenshot: bdc_10.5 List of Users.png
- This page show list of Sites
- Search input and button placed on top of screen
- Add New button can be dead link
- Table header need show active sort
- Filter button placed in the right side. Click filter need show up filter modal window (screenshot: bdc_10.6 Filter pop-up.png)
- Show blue colored links
- Some links use dotted underline style
- Pagination placed in the bottom
- Match content like storyboard

13) Help Desk
screenshot: bdc_11 Help Desk and Bug Screen.png
- This page show list of Help Desk
- Show active menu on header bar
- Search input and button placed on top of screen
- Table header need show active sort
- Filter button placed in the right side
- Show blue colored links
- Pagination placed in the bottom
- Match content like storyboard

14) Device Screen
screenshot: bdc_12 Device Screen.png
- This page show list of Device Admin
- Go to AT&T M2X can be deadlink
- Show progress bar for Site Gateway Error and Site Sensors
- Match color differencene
- Show active menu on header bar
- Search input and button placed on top of screen
- Table header need show active sort
- Filter button placed in the right side
- Show blue colored links
- Pagination placed in the bottom
- Match content like storyboard

Client Priorities (The items that are considered highest prototype priorities)
- Creating quality and efficient HTML/CSS3 code that works in all the requested browsers.
- All elements should be consistent, pay attention to padding, margin, line-height, etc.
- Matching the storyboards (as close as possible) across the required browsers.

CODE REQUIREMENTS:
HTML/HTML5
- Provide comments on the page elements to give clear explanation of the code usage. The goal is to help future developers understand the code.
- Please use clean INDENTATION for all HTML code so future developers can follow the code.
- All HTML code naming should not have any conflicts or errors.
Element and Attribute names should be in lowercase and use a "-" or camel naming to separate multiple-word classes (i.e.. "main-content", or "mainContent)
- Use semantically correct tags- use H tags for headers, etc. Use strong and em tags instead of bold and italic tags.
- No inline CSS styles- all styles must be placed in an external stylesheet.
- Validate your code- reviewers may accept minor validation errors, but please comment your reason for any validation errors. Use the validators listed in the scorecard.

CSS3
- Use CSS3 Media Queries to load different styles for each page and don't build different page for different device/layout.
- Provide comments on the CSS code. We need CSS comments to give a clear explanation of the code usage. The goal is to help future developers understand the code.
- Please use clean INDENTATION for all CSS so developers can follow the code.
- All CSS naming should not have any conflicts.
- As possible use CSS3 style when create all styling.
- Use CSS to space out objects, not clear/transparent images (GIFs or PNGs) and use proper structural CSS to lay out your page. Only use table tags for tables of data/information and not for page layout.

Javascript
- All JavaScript must not have a copyright by a third party.
- You are encouraged to use your own scripts, or scripts that are free, publicly available and do not have copyright statements or author recognition requirements anywhere in the code.

Images
- Images should be properly compressed while still having good visual quality.
- Please use best practice repetition usage of background based image.
- Please use sprites when using icons for your submission.
- Make sure your submission look sharp for Retina and Standard devices

Browsers Requirements
- Chrome Latest Browser
- Safari Latest Browser
- Firefox Latest Browser
- Android Browser
